title: Folk, Rhythm and Life
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.

abstract: Developing initiatives to support the community, environment and the arts. Filmed as part of 'ACMI in the Regions: Stories from Wangaratta'.
description: The Skermer Famliy have been running the Bilyana 'Folk Rhythm & Life Festival', in north-eastern Victoria, since 1996 and in the process raising funds for local and international charities. The festival has always been environmentally sustainable, with the original "drop dunnies" developed by Hamish Skermer now being used not only in Eldorado but also at festivals in Australia and overseas.
